subSections.title: Alternative forms
subSections.text: * {{l|mul|⿱[[雈]][[又]]}} - Contains <font size=4>[[⻀]]</font> (ram's horn component), which is the orthodox form found in the {{w|Shuowen Jiezi}} ({{w2|zh|說文解字}}) etymological dictionary. This form is used in its [[蒦#Derived characters|derived characters]] in Taiwan and Hong Kong.

subSections.title: Han character
subSections.text: {{Han char|rn=140|rad=艸|as=10|sn=14|snmj+=13|four=44407|canj=TOGE|ids=⿱艹隻}} <!-- Originally derived from 雈 but contains 萑 in Unicode charts -->

subSections.title: Usage notes
subSections.text: In {{w|Unicode}} charts and the historical {{w|Kangxi dictionary}}, this character contains the {{w|grass radical}} (<font size=4, lang=zh-hant>[[艹#Translingual|艹]]</font>) and is listed under it.
